items.title: Something to prove: How Blayre Turnbull became the ‘glue’ of the Canadian women’s hockey team
items.summary_auto: Blayre Turnbull, the captain of the Toronto Sceptres is looking to compete in her third Olympics in February. She owns an Olympic gold medal from 2022 and three world championships. Yet for all her success, the 32-year-old always feels like she has something to prove.

items.title: Parts of Alberta just saw some of the most snow they've ever seen in the month of December
items.summary_auto: As of Dec 28, communities including Grande Prairie, Banff and Fort McMurray had seen one of their wettest Decembers on record.

items.title: Kim Jong-un's daughter visits family mausoleum, promoting her potential status as heir in North Korea
items.summary_auto: The teenage daughter of North Korean leader Kim Jong-un made her first known visit to a sacred family mausoleum, a step that experts say bolstered her status as her father's potential heir.

items.title: Trump, top Iranian officials exchange threats over protests in Iran
items.summary_auto: U.S. President Donald Trump and top Iranian officials exchanged duelling threats on Friday as widening economic protests swept across parts of the Islamic Republic, further escalating tensions between the countries.

items.title: Trump and top Iranian officials exchange threats over protests roiling Iran
items.summary_auto: U.S. President Donald Trump and top Iranian officials exchanged duelling threats on Friday as widening economic protests swept across parts of the Islamic Republic, further escalating tensions between the countries.

items.title: Swiss face painful task of identifying victims of deadly bar fire
items.summary_auto: Investigators on Friday set about the painful task of identifying the burned bodies of a blaze that engulfed a crowded bar and killed around 40 people at a New Year's Eve party in the upscale Swiss ski resort of Crans-Montana.

items.title: Leading economists want less talk, more numbers from federal budget watchdog
I spent over a decade obsessed with the gym. I’ve finally let myself stop
items.summary_auto: When Zahra Khozema first started going to the gym in university, it made her feel powerful and beautiful. The guilt and stress came later.

items.title: Quebec City skydivers help set new world record for largest parachute formation
items.summary_auto: Roughly 100 people from around the world, including some Quebecers, travelled to Lake Whales, Fla., in November to break the world record for largest parachute formation.

items.title: Manitoba Hydro fixes downed line, ending Pimicikamak Cree Nation's frigid days in the dark
items.summary_auto: Power is being restored to Pimicikamak Cree Nation nearly four days after a widespread power outage left community members without heat in freezing winter temperatures and promoted a state of emergency.

items.title: Pimicikamak Cree Nation residents rejoice as power returns after Manitoba Hydro fixes downed line
items.summary_auto: Power is being restored to Pimicikamak Cree Nation nearly four days after a widespread power outage left community members without heat in freezing winter temperatures and promoted a state of emergency.

items.title: Canadian ski jumper Abi Strate captures 1st career World Cup gold
items.summary_auto: Canadian ski jumper Abi Strate started the new year with a bang by soaring to her first career World Cup victory on Thursday.

items.title: No drop in Calgarians' water usage despite request from city after water main break
items.summary_auto: A day after officials first asked Calgarians to reduce their water use in the wake of Tuesday’s catastrophic water main break, the city says it is not seeing any real reduction in usage.
